title: Programming I - CS 1310
description: Fundamentals of the software development process with emphasis on program design (algorithm development), structured programming techniques, and code and test using a structured, modular programming language (C).

title: Programming II - CS 1311
description: Properties, representation, and manipulation of internal information structures including lists, queues, stacks, and trees.

title: Sophomore CS Seminar - CS 2110
description: Introduction to various topics in computer science and career planning/preparation, including electronic portfolio and resume preparation, interviewing skills, employer research, professional event attendance/networking, and presentations from industry on careers in computer science, as well as internship/job opportunities.

title: Object Oriented Programming I - CS 2313
description: Introduction to object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts using the C++ programming language. Topics include classes, objects, exception handling, operator overloading, inheritance, polymorphism, templates (generics), stream and file input/output, and the Standard Template Library (STL).

title: Algorithms - CS 2315
description: Topics include review of C programming language concepts and theory, design, analysis, implementation, and application of fundamental computer algorithms.

title: Object Oriented Programming II - CS 2323
description: Review of object-oriented program (OOP) concepts using the Java programming language. Topics (in addition those listed for CS 2313) include graphical user interface (GUI) design and implementation, regular expressions, applets, multithreading, networking, and database access.

title: Computer Architecture - CS 2350
description: Introduction to the logical organization and design of digital computer hardware. Topics include simple digital logic design, memory architectures, microprogramming, instruction set architecture (ISA), and assembly language programming.

title: Junior CS Seminar - CS 3110
description: Extension of various topics in computer science and career planning/preparation, including electronic portfolio and resume preparation, interviewing skills, employer research, professional event attendance/networking, and presentations from industry on careers in computer science, as well as internship/job opportunities.

title: Intro to Systems Analysis and Design - CS 3310
description: An introduction to the use of current methodologies for the analysis and design of various types of computer software systems. Methodologies studied include both the traditional and object-oriented approaches, including Universal Markup Language (UML).

title: Operating Systems - CS 3350
description: The study of the design and implementation of computer operating systems, including issues in process, memory, file system, storage, and device management.

title: Software Engineering - CS 3340
description: Engineering approach to software development focusing on product development in a team with appropriate documentation.

title: Data Communication - CS 4330
description: Fundamentals of data communications, TCP/IP protocol architecture, media, transmission, encoding, error detection and handling, link control, flow control, multiplexing. Local area networks. WAN technology and protocols, circuit and packet switching, IP, routing. Wireless networks. Different applications.

title: Senior CS Seminar - CS 4110
description: Further extension of various topics in computer science and career planning/preparation, including electronic portfolio and resume preparation, interviewing skills, employer research, professional event attendance/networking, and presentations from industry on careers in computer science, as well as internship/job opportunities.

title: Survey of Programming Languages - CS 3335
description: Survey of existing high-level computer programming languages with emphasis on implementation of language concepts. Students design a general-purpose programming language and develop a working compiler for their language.

title: Files & Databases - CS 4320
description: Database system concepts, relational data model and relational database, SQL, relational algebra, entity relationship model, UML diagrams, database programming techniques, functional dependencies and database normalization, database security. File structures, XML files, indexing, hashing, B trees, and B+ trees.

title: Senior Project - CS 4395
description: Application of software engineering techniques to the analysis, design, implementation, and testing of a comprehensive computer software development project.
